item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description:
I am a theoretical condensed-matter physicist working on quantum materials, including superconductors and topological materials. My research focuses in particular on topological superconductivity and the topological classification of superconducting and electronic states.

item.title: Research Overview
item.description:
Real-Band Topology in Superconductors and Superfluids

In systems with space-time symmetries, a distinct type of topological structure known as real-band topology can emerge. Unlike conventional complex-band topology, real-band topology is defined for real Bloch wave functions, and it is characterized by topological invariants such as the Euler class and the Stiefel–Whitney classes. This framework has recently attracted growing interest in the study of twisted bilayer graphene, topological insulators, semimetals, and metamaterials.
